intro: Nigella sativa var. cretica, commonly known as Cretan black cumin, is a variant of the black cumin plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small, annual herb that produces distinctive, spherical seed pods containing dark, aromatic seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers are pale yellow with four petals. The seeds are widely used in traditional medicine and cooking for their pungent, slightly bitter flavor and potential health benefits.
